text: Laurens Leeuwenhoek (born 7 December 1990) is a Dutch korfball player. He is a member of PKC and the Netherlands national korfball team. In 2019 he scored his 1000th Korfbal League goal and became . With the national team he won the gold medal at the 2022 World Games in Birmingham, Alabama. He was at the 2022 World Games the flag barear of the Dutch team and the captain of the Dutch korfball team. ==Achievements== ===Club=== *Korfbal League champion, 3x (2013, 2015, 2021) *National champion field korfball, 3x (2016, 2018, 2021) *Korfball Europa Cup champion, 2x (2014, 2016) * champion, 2x (2016, 2018) * champion, 3x (2015, 2016, 2019) *, 1x (2019) ===National team=== *World Games champion, 3x (2013, 2017, 2022) *World champion, 3x (2011, 2015, 2019) *European champion, 4x (2014, 2016, 2018, 2021) ==References== Category:1990 births Category:Living people Category:Dutch korfball players
title: Laurens Leeuwenhoek
